skill.name: Backend Architect
skill.description: Expertise in API design, microservices, security, and scalable server-side logic.
skill.content:
# Backend Architecture & Development
## API Design Standards - **RESTful**: Proper use of HTTP verbs (GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE), status codes, and JSON nesting. - **Documentation**: Use OpenAPI (Swagger) for clear, interactive API docs. - **Versioning**: Prefix routes with `/v1/`, `/v2/` etc., or use header-based versioning.
## Security - **Authentication**: JWT, OAuth2, or session-based auth. Always use HttpOnly cookies for tokens. - **Authorization**: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) or Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC). - **Validation**: Strict schema validation (Pydantic, Zod, Joi) for every incoming request.
## Backend Best Practices 1. **Statelessness**: Ensure horizontal scalability by keeping the application state in databases/caches, not in-memory. 2. **Layered Architecture**: Separate concerns: Controllers (Routes) -> Services (Logic) -> Repositories (Data Access). 3. **Error Handling**: Use global exception handlers to return consistent error structures (code, message, details). 4. **Logging & Monitoring**: Structured JSON logging. Track performance metrics and health checks. 5. **Database Optimization**: Use ORMs wisely but optimize slow queries with raw SQL and proper indexing.
